page.title: 04THE CATTLE MARKET,MANSFIELD
page.content: { {THE CATTLE MARKET}IN MANSFIELD HAS EXISTED ON IT'S PRESENT SITE SINCE 1876.IT CONSISTS OF BOTH OPEN AND COVERED PENS AND THERE IS A SMALL COVERED AUCTIONEER'S RING.THE GENERAL CATTLE MARKET TAKES PLACE EVERY MONDAY AND THERE ARE HORSE SALES ON OCCASIONAL THURSDAYS. ON 15th.JULY 1985 THERE WERE APPROXIMATELY 168 SHEEP,30 PIGS AND 50 COWS FOR SALE,ALL WERE FULLY GROWN ANIMALS.THE SALE OF ANIMALS IS CONTROLLED BY AN AUCTIONEER WHO WALKS FROM PEN TO PEN RINGING A BELL TO INDICATE HE IS READY TO BEGIN. THERE IS NO PRE_SET PRICE ON THE ANIMALS AND HE TAKES THE HIGHEST BID. THE CATTLE MARKET NO LONGER HOLDS ITS FORMER PLACE OF PROMINENCE IN THE LIFE OF THE TOWN.
